title: Problem-Based Learning on Dyspnea Symptoms Using Augmented Reality

context.prior_knowledge: Basic medical terminology and understanding of the fundamental structure of the respiratory system
context.additional_context: Augmented reality-based pre-learning program preparing for clinical practice

learning_goals: Learners can identify abnormal lung sounds (auscultation) in patients with respiratory distress with 80% accuracy in an AR simulation environment.
Learners can analyze 3D lung pathology models that induce respiratory distress and explain major diseases (e.g., pneumonia, emphysema) with 100% accuracy.
Based on real patient cases implemented in augmented reality, learners can collaboratively develop symptom-cause-treatment linkage problem-solving strategies with over 90% accuracy.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
